feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 3:11PM AKDT until October 15 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Copper River Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible Tonight and Sunday in the Interior... A strong storm in the Gulf of Alaska will send a weather front north into the Interior tonight bringing warmer temperatures along with some snow and a chance of freezing rain to the area. Freezing rain will mix with the snow so no accumulation is expected, but it will create slippery driving and walking
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 2:28PM AKDT until October 15 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility expected. East winds gusting to 45 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Over Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 10 PM AKDT today.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued October 15 at 2:15PM AKDT until October 17 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT AKDT SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight AKDT Sunday night.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 2:15PM AKDT until October 17 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT AKDT SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight AKDT Sunday night.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 1:01PM AKDT until October 16 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night. ... Northeast winds gusting to 40 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast from Point Barrow to Wainwright Sunday night through Monday night. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Tuesday as winds decrease. Beach erosion is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday And Sunday Night... East winds gusting to 55 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast starting early Sunday. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Monday as winds turn offshore and decrease. Beach erosion is expected. Waves could wash onto the Dock at Prudhoe Bay.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 7:22PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Logan, south central Johnson, northeastern Yell and southwestern Pope Counties through 745 PM CDT... entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Yell County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 3:11PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima at least through Monday for Okanogan, Chelan, and Douglas counties. Particulate matter (PM2.5) levels may vary from unhealthy to hazardous at times close to the current wildfires in Chelan and western Okanogan counties.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 12:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT MONDAY... The Southwest Clean Air Agency has continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 5 PM PDT Monday. An Air Quality Advisory for Smoke remains in effect. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW BEGINNING SUNDAY EVENING AND LASTING THROUGH MONDAY IN IRON AND ASHLAND COUNTIES... Lake effect snow showers are likely beginning Sunday evening and lasting through Monday in eastern Ashland County and throughout Iron County in northwestern Wisconsin. Two to five inches of snowfall is expected, but local amounts of six to eight inches
